text: Klaus FatmirEkskluzive: Basha, Gjasula, Abrashi,Berisha e Llullaku me pasaportë shqiptare (dekreti) aSport.al Gjasula (born 14 December 1989) is an Albanian professional footballer who plays as a defensive midfielder for Hamburger SV. He holds both Albanian and German citizenship and his parents were born in the Yugoslavian region of Kosovo.Soccerway profileLord Helmchen grätscht sich durch den DFB-Pokal He is the younger brother of Jürgen Gjasula. ==International career== Gjasula made his Albania national football team debut on 7 September 2019 in a Euro 2020 qualifier against France, when he substituted Ylber Ramadani in the 53rd minute and was cautioned in the remaining time. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|National Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |Waldhof Mannheim |2011–12 |Regionalliga Süd |25||1||0||0||0||0||0||0||25||1 |- |MSV Duisburg II |2012–13 |Regionalliga West |23||0||0||0||0||0||0||0||23||0 |- |rowspan="4"|Kickers Offenbach |2013–14 |Regionalliga Südwest |27||2||0||0||0||0||0||0||27||2 |- |2014–15 |Regionalliga Südwest |33||0||3||0||0||0||0||0||36||0 |- |2015–16 |Regionalliga Südwest |17||2||0||0||0||0||0||0||17||2 |- !colspan="2" | Total !77!!4!!3!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!80!!4 |- |Stuttgarter Kickers |2015–16 |3.
